page.title: 17TRAFFIC SURVEY:10/6/85
page.content: Gibbet Hill had more buses because it has 2 bus stops. The buses from Kenilworth that we saw on the bypass were going to Coventry and Birmingham. The bypass was used more for lorries delivering things to other parts of the country.Most of them were Walker's Crisp trucks.Most of the heavy goods vehicles were travelling on the bypass.The quiet vehicles were travelling on Gibbet Hill because of the University. There wouldn't be a lot of bicycles on the bypass because of the danger of being run over. At the bypass we counted 355 cars and 127 at Gibbet Hill. The buses on the bypass were quite full but the buses on Gibbet Hill were empty.
